required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Re-evaluation of Blind Intubation Through the Air-Q Intubating Laryngeal Airway
clinical_study.official_title: Blind Tracheal Intubation Through the Air-Q Intubating Laryngeal Airway in Pediatric Patients. Re-evaluation. A Randomized Controlled Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the success rate of blind technique with correction manoeuvres versus fiber optic- guided Intubation through the air Q laryngeal airway in pediatric patients

detailed_description.textblock: A prior G-power analysis was done to estimate the sample size. The primary outcome of this study was the first trial success rate. Using fibre exact test and assuming alpha (type I error) = 0.05 and beta (type II error) = 0.2 (power =80%), 58 patients per group would be sufficient to detect a difference 10 % in success rate among the groups. A drop out 10% of cases was expected; therefore 63 patients were required in each group to detect the difference.

primary_outcome.time_frame: during first trial of intubation procedure
primary_outcome.description: percentage of cases of successful tracheal intubation during the first trial

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from beginning of manipulation of the endotracheal tube till end of second trial either by successful intubation or failed intubation procedure
secondary_outcome.description: percentage of cases underwent successful tracheal intubation during either first or second trial

secondary_outcome.time_frame: procedure (Time from beginning of air-Q insertion till full capno-graphic wave)
secondary_outcome.description: time needed to get full capno-graphic waves through connection of air Q to breathing circuit

secondary_outcome.time_frame: procedure (Time from beginning of manipulation of the ETT till full capno-graphic wave)
secondary_outcome.description: time needed to get full capno-graphic waves through connection of endotracheal tube to breathing circuit

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After induction of anesthesia till 10 minutes after intubation
After induction of anesthesia till 10 minutes after intubation
from extubation till 24 hours after extubation
from extubation till 24 hours after extubation
from extubation till 24 hours after extubation
secondary_outcome.description: and its grade if present Grades of hoarseness: 1=non, 2= mild, 3= moderate, 4= severe)

clinical_study.condition: Techniques of Endotracheal Intubation in Pediatrics

arm_group.description: Patients were intubated through the air-Q blindly
Patients were intubated through the air-Q using fibreoptic bronchoscope

intervention.description: underwent blind intubation with correction manoeuvres

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status I-II
- Body weight from 4 to 30 kg
Exclusion Criteria:
- Obesity
- History of gastroesophageal reflux
- History of hyperactive airway
- Patients with congenital disorders associated with difficult airway

overall_official.last_name: Enas A Abd el Motlb, MD

clinical_study.keyword: air-Q, blind intubation, correction maneuvers, fiberoptic guided intubation
